bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Charles H. Coles, February 3, 1942

div1.p: Hench thanks Coles for the article on Operti, who did the painting of Camp Lazear, and asks if he knows the location of the painting.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Charles H. Coles, February 3, 1942
div1.opener:
yf.
February 3, 1942
Mr. Charles H. Coles
Chief of Photo Division
The American Museum of Natural History
Central Park West at 79th Street
New York, N. Y.
My dear Mr. Coles:
div1.p:
Thank you very kindly for sending me the
article on Albert Operti, painter of the painting of
Camp Lazear, a photograph of which you sent me. May I
ask you one more question. Where the devil is the
painting? Is it in your museum somewhere?
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
